SEARCH
Module eus.ehu.txipironesmastodonfx
Package eus.ehu.txipironesmastodonfx.data_access

Class DBAccessManager

java.lang.Object
eus.ehu.txipironesmastodonfx.data_access.DBAccessManager
public class DBAccessManager extends Object
This class is responsible for managing access to the database. Everything from creating, inserting and extracting the data will be controlled by this class.
Author:
Nicolás Aguado, Haizea Bermejo, Marcos Chouciño, Xiomara Cáceces

      public static final String dbName

  • Constructor Details

    • DBAccessManager

      public DBAccessManager()

  • Method Details

    • isDbReachable

      public static boolean isDbReachable()
      This method will check if the database is reachable. It will check if the database file exists and if it can be opened.
      Returns:
      boolean - True if the database is reachable, false otherwise

    • createDbFile

      public static void createDbFile() throws IOException
      This method will create the database file. If it exists, it will overwrite it. SO BE CAREFUL WHEN CALLING!
      Throws:
      IOException - - If the file can't be created

    • checkAndCreateTables

      public static void checkAndCreateTables() throws SQLException
      This method will create the tables needed for the application. If the tables already exist, it will send the queries, but because its CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXIST practically it will do nothing.
      Throws:
      SQLException - - If the queries can't be executed

    • getAccounts

      public static List<Account> getAccounts() throws SQLException
      Returns all accounts contained in the database.
      Returns:
      (List invalid input: '<' Account >) - The list of accounts
      Throws:
      SQLException - - If the query fails to execute

    • isAccountInDb

      public static boolean isAccountInDb(String id) throws SQLException
      Checks if the account is in the db. We can be sure that the parameter (id) is safe because there will not be two mastodon accounts with the same id. (in the same server)
      Parameters:
      id - (String) - The id of the account
      Returns:
      (boolean) - True if the account is in the db, false otherwise
      Throws:
      SQLException - - If the query fails to execute

    • removeAccountFromDbId

      public static void removeAccountFromDbId(String id) throws SQLException
      Removes an account from the database.
      Parameters:
      id - (String) - The id of the account to remove
      Throws:
      SQLException

    • getSysVarFromDbId

      public static String getSysVarFromDbId(String id) throws SQLException
      Gets the system variable associated with an account.
      Parameters:
      id - (String) - The id of the account
      Returns:
      (String) - The system variable associated with the account
      Throws:
      SQLException - - If the query fails to execute

    • getRefFromId

      public static Integer getRefFromId(String AccId) throws SQLException
      Gets the ref associated with an account.
      Parameters:
      AccId - (String) - The id of the account
      Returns:
      (String) - The ref associated with the account
      Throws:
      SQLException - - If the query fails to execute

    • getSysVarFromRef

      public static String getSysVarFromRef(Integer ref) throws SQLException
      Gets the system variable associated with an account.
      Parameters:
      ref - (String) - The ref of the account
      Returns:
      (String) - The system variable associated with the account
      Throws:
      SQLException

    • deleteRefFromDb

      public static void deleteRefFromDb(Integer ref, String tablename) throws SQLException
      This generic method will be used to delete entries with an specific ref in a specific table.
      Parameters:
      ref - (String) - The ref of the account
      tablename - (String) - The name of the table
      Throws:
      SQLException

    • insertTootsInDb

      public static void insertTootsInDb(List<Toot> toots, Integer ref) throws SQLException
      Method to insert a list of toots in the database. It will have a ref parameter to know which account the toots belong to.
      Parameters:
      toots - (List invalid input: '<' Toot >) - The list of toots to insert
      ref - (String) - The ref of the account
      Throws:
      SQLException

    • insertFollowInDb

      public static void insertFollowInDb(List<Follow> followList, Integer ref, boolean following) throws SQLException
      Method to insert a list of follow in the database. If the following parameter is true, it will insert the accounts into the following table. If not, it will insert the accounts into the follower table.
      Parameters:
      followList - (String) - The list of accounts to insert
      ref - (String) - The ref of the account
      following - (boolean) - True if the accounts are following the account, false otherwise
      Throws:
      SQLException

    • addAccount

      public static void addAccount(String destinationSysVar, String id, String token) throws SQLException, IOException, UnsupportedOperationException
      This method will add an account to the database. It will first fetch the account data from the api, then it will insert it in the database and finally if the insertion went well it will set the destination sys variable.
      Parameters:
      destinationSysVar - (String) - The destination sys variable
      id - (String) - The id of the account
      token - (String) - The mastodon access token of the account
      Throws:
      SQLException - - If the query fails to execute
      IOException - - If the setting of the system variable fails
      UnsupportedOperationException - - If the operating system is unsupported (cannot set sysenv)
